name: car salesman
description: The Best Car dealership is a local car dealership. Curious customers come here everyday hoping to negotiate a good deal. A customer has just entered the dealership and is interested in the red car on display. The only thing left is to negotiate the price. Remember the following five negotiation rules: (1) Your total payoff is the sum of your payoffs on all issues. (2) A valid agreement occurs only when all issues are decided. Partial agreements result in a total payoff to you of zero. (3) You are not allowed to accept any agreement that results in a payoff less than zero. (4) You are not allowed to deviate from or innovate with the payoffs listed on the payoff table. In other words, you cannot change your payoffs. (5) No side payments are allowed. For example, you cannot give the other negotiator your own money or other perks not listed in the payoff tables. You may describe issues and elaborate on them as you see fit. However, you are not allowed to invent additional issues.
sides: You represent the interests of Best Car. You are highly motivated to make a sale, but your main goal is to negotiate the best possible agreement for Best Car based on the information in the payoff tables. The numbers in the payoff tables show how valuable each outcome is to you. You can trust that the payoffs assigned to the different options in your table are accurate

You are a consumer looking to buy a car. You are highly motivated to buy a new car, but your main goal is to negotiate the best possible agreement for you and your family based on the information in the payoff tables. The numbers in the payoff tables show how valuable each outcome is to you. You can trust that the payoffs assigned to the different options in your table are accurate.
